channel.title: Comments on: Testing probability theories with students
channel.description: iteration, making, building, and coding in education

item.title: By: Evan Weinberg
item.dc:creator: Evan Weinberg
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/05/21/testing-probability-theories-with-students/#comment-293">Andy "SuperFly" Rundquist</a>.
Thanks Andy - wow, that is a great idea. Definitely a great twist and a way to encourage some modeling and testing.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Andy “SuperFly” Rundquist.

Thanks Andy – wow, that is a great idea. Definitely a great twist and a way to encourage some modeling and testing.

item.title: By: Dan Meyer
item.dc:creator: Dan Meyer
item.description: Impossibly badass. Both the original setup and Andy's suggested follow-up question.
item.content:encoded: Impossibly badass. Both the original setup and Andy’s suggested follow-up question.

item.title: By: Andy "SuperFly" Rundquist
item.dc:creator: Andy "SuperFly" Rundquist
item.description: This is awesome! Here's one question I have: If you set up a new mystery button, could they determine what its rules are?
item.content:encoded: This is awesome! Here’s one question I have: If you set up a new mystery button, could they determine what its rules are?
